other_tests.findings: Patients demonstrated symptoms of increased intracranial pressure, including papilledema, anterior fontanelle bulge, and thumbprinting.
other_tests.changes_over_time: 60% of patients with progressive craniosynostosis exhibited papilledema preoperatively, compared with 25% of classic craniosynostosis; 93% showed thumbprinting compared to 67% in the classic group.

other_tests.findings: 11 out of 13 patients tested exhibited mutations in exon 7 or 9 of FGFR2.
Normal findings in earlier examinations; severe swelling and papilledema noted at later stages.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Visual loss was detected following a fall; previously normal eye examinations failed to predict later complications.

other_tests.findings: Severe craniosynostosis with high intracranial pressure, evident thumbprinting and anterior fontanelle bulge.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Changes showed progression from normal sutures at 1 year to fusion of all sutures by 5 years.
